Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: SDIP3D Process
Screen.Label: 3D Semblance Dip Mix
QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS=
QUICK_DIP_SEARCH =
OPT_SEMB =
Whether to weight input trace by local semblance.
PWR_SEMB =
Power of semblance for dip mix.
FCTR_MIX =
Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
WIN_LEN =
Semblance window length in seconds for dip search.
OPT_TAPER=
Type of taper to apply.
HDR_X =
HDR_Y =
Header word.
X_INIT =
Y_INIT =
First (or any) bin center.
X_INC =
Y_INC =
Bin increment.
MAX_X_BINS =
MAX_Y_BINS =
Maximum approximate number of bins (traces).
DIP_MAX_X =
DIP_MAX_Y =
Maximum dip (ms/trace).
dip_inc_x =
dip_inc_y =
Dip increment (ms/trace).
nxdips =
nydips =
Total number of dips.
NUM_TR_DIP_X=
NUM_TR_DIP_Y=
#Traces each side for dip search.
nxgather =
nygather =
Total #traces for dip search.
NUM_TR_MIX_X=
NUM_TR_MIX_Y=
#Traces each side to mix.
nxmix =
nymix =
Total #traces to mix.

Help.Tip: Option whether to decimate the traces used for the dip search.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS
Option whether to decimate the traces used for the dip search.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES  use a subset of the traces in moving gather for dip search.
 Allowed = NO   use all traces in moving gather for dip search.
 
 If QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS = YES, only the traces along the two orthogonal axes
 through the middle of the moving gather, plus all additional traces to be
 subsequently mixed, are used in the dip search.
 
 For example, using a moving gather containing 7 x 7 traces total, with plans
 to mix 3 x 3 traces in the middle of the moving gather:
 
   QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS = NO will use all 49 traces for the dip search.
   QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS = YES will use only 17 traces for the dip search.
 
 Using QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS = YES and/or QUICK_DIP_SEARCH = YES will speed up
 the dip search, which dominates the timing when dip searching is being done,
 with probably little loss of quality.

Help.Tip: Option whether to decimate the dip searches being performed.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - QUICK_DIP_SEARCH
Option whether to decimate the dip searches being performed.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES  use a subset of combinations of X and Y dips for dip search.
 Allowed = NO   use all combinations of X and Y dips for dip search.
 
 If QUICK_DIP_SEARCH = YES, only the dips in the X and Y orthogonal
 directions, but not dips in other directions, are used in the dip search.
 
 For example, testing 7 dips in the X direction and 7 dips in the Y direction:
 
   QUICK_DIP_SEARCH = NO will use all 49 dip combinations in the dip search.
   QUICK_DIP_SEARCH = YES will use only 14 dips in the dip search.
 
 Using QUICK_DIP_WEIGHTS = YES and/or QUICK_DIP_SEARCH = YES will speed up
 the dip search, which dominates the timing when dip searching is being done,
 with probably little loss of quality.

Help.Tip: Option whether to weight input trace by the local semblance value.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - OPT_SEMB
Option whether to weight input trace by the local semblance value.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO
 
 If OPT_SEMB = NO, then only the mixed trace is weighted by the semblance:
 
    TR_OUT = TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) * SEMB**PWR_SEMB.
 
 If OPT_SEMB = YES, then both the input trace and the mixed trace are weighted
 by the semblance:
 
    TR_OUT = [ TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) ] * SEMB**PWR_SEMB.
 
 OPT_SEMB = YES results in an output trace that is more strongly modulated by
 the local semblance than if OPT_SEMB = NO.

Help.Tip: Raise local semblance to the PWR_SEMB power for trace weighting.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PWR_SEMB
Raise local semblance to the PWR_SEMB power for trace weighting.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = real >= 0.0

Help.Tip: Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - FCTR_MIX
Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = 0.0 <= real <= 1.0

Help.Tip: Length of the time window, in sec, for the semblance calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - WIN_LEN
Length of the time window, in sec, for the semblance calculation.
 
 Default = 0.1
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 WIN_LEN is used for dip search calculations prior to generating mixed traces.

Help.Tip: Type of taper to apply when forming the mixed trace.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - OPT_TAPER
Type of taper to apply when forming the mixed trace.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = LINEAR
 Allowed = COSINE
 Allowed = NONE
 
 If OPT_TAPER = LINEAR or COSINE, then a taper is applied to traces to be
 mixed so that the center trace has the greatest weight and the farthest
 traces have the least weight.  Either a linear or cosine taper is used, as
 specified.
 
 If OPT_TAPER = NONE, then the traces to be mixed are all weighted uniformly.

Help.Tip: Header word containing the X coordinate.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - HDR_X
Header word containing the X coordinate.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Header word containing the Y coordinate.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - HDR_Y
Header word containing the Y coordinate.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: X coordinate of the first (or any) trace in the X direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - X_INIT
X coordinate of the first (or any) trace in the X direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the center of any bin measured in the X direction.
 This value does not have to correspond to the first actual trace in the
 X direction, since this could in fact vary from line to line.

Help.Tip: Y coordinate of the first (or any) trace in the Y direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - Y_INIT
Y coordinate of the first (or any) trace in the Y direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the center of any bin measured in the Y direction.
 This value does not have to correspond to the first actual trace (or
 first actual line) in the Y direction.

Help.Tip: Increment of HDR_X between bin centers in the X direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - X_INC
Increment of HDR_X between bin centers in the X direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the bin increment (or width) in the X direction.

Help.Tip: Increment of HDR_Y between bin centers in the Y direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - Y_INC
Increment of HDR_Y between bin centers in the Y direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the bin increment (or width) in the Y direction.

Help.Tip: Maximum number of X bins in any one Y-line.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - MAX_X_BINS
Maximum number of X bins in any one Y-line.
 
 Default = blank
 Allowed = integer > 0
 
 This value must be specified.  The maximum number of traces which will
 be stored on disk at any one time will be slightly greater than MAX_X_BINS
 times (2*NUM_TR_MIX_Y + 1).

Help.Tip: Maximum number of Y bins (lines).
Help.Text:
sdip3d - MAX_Y_BINS
Maximum number of Y bins (lines).
 
 Default = blank
 Allowed = integer > 0 (or blank if not requesting diagnostic traces)
 
 This value must be specified if you are requesting any diagnostic output
 files (see separate screen).
 
 This parameter is needed only for reserving disk space for the requested
 files, and needs to be approximate only.  But if the files will be
 very large, the parameter is important because the number of available
 file extents may otherwise be insufficient.

Help.Tip: Maximum dip in X direction to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - DIP_MAX_X
Maximum dip in X direction to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 
 Dips are in ms/trace in the X direction.
 
 A total of (2*DIP_X/DIP_INC_X + 1) dips are tested in the X direction,
 from -DIP_MAX_X to +DIP_MAX_X.
 
 Computer time is roughly proportional to the number of dips tested in the
 X direction times the number of dips tested in the Y direction.

Help.Tip: Maximum dip in Y direction to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - DIP_MAX_Y
Maximum dip in Y direction to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 
 Dips are in ms/trace in the Y direction.
 
 A total of (2*DIP_X/DIP_INC_Y + 1) dips are tested in the Y direction,
 from -DIP_MAX_Y to +DIP_MAX_Y.
 
 Computer time is roughly proportional to the number of dips tested in the
 X direction times the number of dips tested in the Y direction.

Help.Tip: Dip increment in X direction to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - DIP_INC_X
Dip increment in X direction to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Dip increments are in ms/trace in the X direction.
 
 A total of (2*DIP_X/DIP_INC_X + 1) dips are tested in the X direction,
 from -DIP_MAX_X to +DIP_MAX_X.
 
 Computer time is roughly proportional to the number of dips tested in the
 X direction times the number of dips tested in the Y direction.
 
 This value is calculated from the Nyquist frequency and the NUM_TR_DIP_X
 parameter to keep from aliasing the dip search on the farthest traces.

Help.Tip: Dip increment in Y direction to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - DIP_INC_Y
Dip increment in Y direction to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Dip increments are in ms/trace in the Y direction.
 
 A total of (2*DIP_X/DIP_INC_Y + 1) dips are tested in the Y direction,
 from -DIP_MAX_Y to +DIP_MAX_Y.
 
 Computer time is roughly proportional to the number of dips tested in the
 X direction times the number of dips tested in the Y direction.
 
 This value is calculated from the Nyquist frequency and the NUM_TR_DIP_Y
 parameter to keep from aliasing the dip search on the farthest traces.

Help.Tip: Total number of dips to be tested in X direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NXDIPS
Total number of dips to be tested in X direction.

Help.Tip: Total number of dips to be tested in Y direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NYDIPS
Total number of dips to be tested in Y direction.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in X direction for dip testing.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NUM_TR_DIP_X
Number of traces on each side in X direction for dip testing.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = integer >= 0
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace.
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) traces are used in the dip search calculation
 in the X direction.
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces are used
 altogether in the dip search calculation.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in Y direction for dip testing.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NUM_TR_DIP_Y
Number of traces on each side in Y direction for dip testing.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = integer >= 0
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace.
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces are used in the dip search calculation
 in the Y direction.
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces are used
 altogether in the dip search calculation.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces in X direction for dip search.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NXGATHER
Total number of traces in X direction for dip search.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces in Y direction for dip search.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NYGATHER
Total number of traces in Y direction for dip search.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in X direction to mix together.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NUM_TR_MIX_X
Number of traces on each side in X direction to mix together.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = integer >= 0 and =< NUM_TR_DIP_X
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace.
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_MIX_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_MIX_Y + 1) traces are mixed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in Y direction to mix together.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NUM_TR_MIX_Y
Number of traces on each side in Y direction to mix together.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = integer >= 0 and =< NUM_TR_DIP_Y
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace.
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_MIX_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_MIX_Y + 1) traces are mixed.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces in X direction to mix together.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NXMIX
Total number of traces in X direction to mix together.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces in Y direction to mix together.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - NYMIX
Total number of traces in Y direction to mix together.

Help.Tip: Message regarding number of requested diagnostic files.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - MESSAGE
Message regarding number of requested diagnostic files.
 
 This information refers to the diagnostic files requested on the
 "Diagnostic Output Files" screen.  That screen should be visited
 to insure that the requests are correct and the status of each
 requested file is acceptable.

Help.Tip: Base name for pathnames for diagnostic trace output files.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - BASENAME
Base name for pathnames for diagnostic trace output files.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 This basename is used to create path names for files which will contain
 diagnostic traces.  This basename must not include a filename extension.

Help.Tip: Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_MEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_MEDGE
Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_MEDGE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for Meek edge detection traces.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MEDGE
Pathname for Meek edge detection traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One edge detection trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MEDGE_INFO
Status of PATH_MEDGE.

Help.Tip: Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_SEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_SEDGE
Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_SEDGE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for semblance edge detection traces.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_SEDGE
Pathname for semblance edge detection traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One edge detection trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_SEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_SEDGE_INFO
Status of PATH_SEDGE.

Help.Tip: Whether to save mixed traces to PATH_MIXED.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_MIXED
Whether to save mixed traces to PATH_MIXED.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for mixed traces.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MIXED
Pathname for mixed traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One mixed trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MIXED.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MIXED_INFO
Status of PATH_MIXED.

Help.Tip: Whether to save semblance traces to PATH_SEMB.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_SEMB
Whether to save semblance traces to PATH_SEMB.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of semblance values found.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_SEMB
Pathname for diagnostic traces of semblance values found.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One semblance trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Semblances are between zero and one.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_SEMB.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_SEMB_INFO
Status of PATH_SEMB.

Help.Tip: Whether to save dip traces to PATH_XDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_XDIP
Whether to save dip traces to PATH_XDIP.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the X direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_XDIP
Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the X direction.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One dip trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Dips are in milliseconds per trace.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be dead if dip searches are not done in the X direction.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_XDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_XDIP_INFO
Status of PATH_XDIP.

Help.Tip: Whether to save dip traces to PATH_YDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_YDIP
Whether to save dip traces to PATH_YDIP.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the Y direction.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_YDIP
Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the Y direction.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One dip trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Dips are in milliseconds per trace.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be dead if dip searches are not done in the Y direction.
 (This is the case for the 2D SDIP process.)

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_YDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_YDIP_INFO
Status of PATH_YDIP.

Help.Tip: Whether to save original moving gathers to PATH_ORIG.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_ORIG
Whether to save original moving gathers to PATH_ORIG.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of original gathers.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_ORIG
Pathname for diagnostic traces of original gathers.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 These are the original moving gathers used for doing the dip search.
 One moving gather will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Each moving gather contains all of the traces used to do a dip search
 for each trace processed.  Each moving gather will contain
 (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces.
 
 This file can be very large.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_ORIG.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_ORIG_INFO
Status of PATH_ORIG.

Help.Tip: Whether to save flattened moving gathers to PATH_FLAT.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_FLAT
Whether to save flattened moving gathers to PATH_FLAT.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of flattened gathers.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_FLAT
Pathname for diagnostic traces of flattened gathers.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 These are the moving gathers as they have been flattened using the results
 of the dip search.  One moving gather will be output to the file for each
 trace processed.  Each moving gather contains all of the traces used to do
 a dip search for each trace processed.  Each moving gather will contain
 (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces.
 
 This file can be very large.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be same as original gathers if dip searches are not done.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_FLAT.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_FLAT_INFO
Status of PATH_FLAT.

Help.Tip: Whether to save middle traces to PATH_MIDDLE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - SAVE_MIDDLE
Whether to save middle traces to PATH_MIDDLE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for middle trace of each moving gather.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MIDDLE
Pathname for middle trace of each moving gather.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 Each trace output will be the trace from the moving gather which is the
 closest to the output trace location.  Therefore each trace should be the
 same as an original input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MIDDLE.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PATH_MIDDLE_INFO
Status of PATH_MIDDLE.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
sdip3d - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : SDIP3D             (3D Semblance Dip Mix)
 Category   : filters
 Written    : 1996-09-10   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : 3D coherence enhancement by mixing along dominant dip direction.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 SDIP3D is a 3D coherence enhancement process that operates on stacked or
 migrated data.  Each input trace is replaced by a mix of itself and its
 neighbors.  Traces are mixed along the direction of dominant dip as
 determined by a semblance search within small windows down the trace.
 
 SDIP3D is designed to be functionally identical to SDIP, but to allow dip
 estimates and dip mixing in both the X and Y directions.  SDIP3D is somewhat
 slower than SDIP because it uses the MGATHER3D primitive to maintain a
 3D moving gather using a disk file for temporary trace storage.  SDIP uses
 the MGATHER primitive to maintain a 2D moving gather without the need of
 a disk file.  Both SDIP and SDIP3D use the SDIPUTIL primitive to do the
 dip search and calculate the output traces.
 
 SDIP3D will also be slowed down with respect to SDIP if dips are searched
 for in both the X and Y directions, since all combinations of X and Y dips
 are tested.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         DETAILS OF OPERATION
 
 1. Within each window, (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces,
    centered on the input trace, are used to perform a semblance dip search
    to determine which dip has the maximum semblance.  A total of
    (2*DIP_MAX_X + 1) times (2*DIP_MAX_Y + 1) dips are tested.  The dip with
    the maximum semblance is referred to as the dominant dip.  Each window
    length is WIN_LEN seconds long, and the windows move down the trace one
    sample at a time.
 
 
 2. For each window, a total of (2*NUM_TR_MIX_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_MIX_Y + 1)
    traces, centered on the input trace, are weighted by the taper specified
    by OPT_TAPER and then mixed along the dominant dip to form a mixed
    trace.
 
 
 3. The output trace is formed from the mixed trace, sample by sample, using
    one of the following two equations:
 
    If OPT_SEMB = NO, then only the mixed trace is weighted by the
    semblance and the output trace is formed as follows:
 
      TR_OUT =   TR_IN * FCTR_MIX  +  TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) * SEMB**PWR_SEMB
 
    If OPT_SEMB = YES, then the input trace and the mixed trace are both
    weighted by the semblance and the output trace is formed as follows:
 
      TR_OUT = [ TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) ] * SEMB**PWR_SEMB
 
    where:
 
      TR_OUT   = Output trace.
      TR_IN    = Input trace.
      TR_MIX   = Mixed trace.
      FCTR_MIX = Weighting factor between input and mixed trace.
      SEMB     = Local semblance measured along the dominant dip.
      PWR_SEMB = Power to raise the semblance for semblance weighting.
 
    OPT_SEMB = YES results in an output trace that is more strongly modulated
    by the local semblance than if OPT_SEMB = NO.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
  1. The bin centers and bin widths are used to identify the locations
     of traces to use for dip searching and mixing.  This insures that
     the correct traces are used in both the X and Y directions, even if
     the starting X coordinates of different lines are not the same or
     there are missing traces.  The following binning parameters:
                        X_INIT       Y_INIT
                        X_INC        Y_INC
     should match the actual inline and crossline spacing of the input
     traces.  If two or more traces fall into the same bin, only one
     trace in the bin will be used for dip searching and mixing.
 
 
  4. Example of use of the following dip parameters:
                        DIP_X         DIP_Y
                        DIP_INC_X     DIP_INC_Y
 
     Using DIP_X = 10 and DIP_INC_X = 2:
            five negative X-dips (-10,-8,-6,-4,-2),
            one zero X-dip,
            and five positive X-dips (2,4,6,8,10) will be tested.
 
     Using DIP_Y = 6 and DIP_INC_Y = 3:
            two negative Y-dips (-6,-3),
            one zero Y-dip,
            and two positive Y-dips (3,6) will be tested.
 
     WARNING: Computer time is proportional to the product of the number
     of dips tested in each direction!
 
 
  6. The input traces should be sorted to either inline or crossline
     order.  The inline direction corresponds to traces in the same
     Y bin, and with X bins incrementing by one bin per trace.  The
     crossline direction corresponds to traces in the same X bin, and
     with Y bins incrementing by one bin per trace.  The trace spacing
     should be such that there is generally one trace in each bin,
     although some bins can be empty.
 
 
  7. Each output trace is a mixed version of each input trace.  Traces
     are output in the same order as they are input.

                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
009. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
008. 2006-01-10  B. Menger  Removed Unused Variables.
  7. 2004-08-10  Lucas      Added wrapup logic to combine the SDIPUTIL files
                            into single files when running a parallel job.
  6. 2004-06-08  Lucas      Added logic block for parallelization.
  5. 2002-03-11  Stoeckley  Set limits on number of displayed digits in GUI
                             for floating point numbers to correct an
                             occasional GUI display problem..
  4. 2001-12-13  Stoeckley  Change the DIP_INC_X and DIP_INC_Y parameters
                             to be informational only (now automatically
                             calculated to protect against aliasing); add
                             MAX_Y_BINS parameter; put output diagnostics
                             onto separate trace files so that they can all
                             be obtained at the same time; improve the dip
                             search algorithm.
  3. 2001-08-24  Stoeckley  Add options for speeding up dip searches.
  2. 2001-08-17  Stoeckley  Converted from old system, replacing some code
                             with calls to the new SDIPUTIL, MGATHER3D, and
                             TWEIGHTS primitives.
  1. 1996-09-10  Stoeckley  Original Version.
